item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Ukraine to invade Belarus?? If those troop numbers are correct (which is hard to believe), it doesn't sound like they would need so many troops to defend Ukraine. It might be quite easy to trigger an uprising to depose Lukashenko, gain new allies and free up more troops eventually. Russia would have no means to respond.https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/belarus-lukashenko-says-nearly-third-army-sent-ukraine-border-belta-reports-2024-08-18/

item.title: Euromaidan Press
item.description: The last third major bridge over the Seym River reportedly destroyed in Kursk Oblast's Glushkovsky district (upd: photo shows other bridge)This is according to a Ukrainian Telegram channel and Russian milblogger Romanov. The move was easily predictable after the destruction of two other bridges, and for Russians, it complicates the defense of a 600+ sq km area separated from the "mainland" by the Seym.Now Russian logistics will have to rely on pontoon bridges and boats to supply the

item.title: Jeff Jarvis
item.description: Just imagine if today we had no Democratic presidential nominee, let alone vice-presidential, if The Times, The Post, Ezra Klein, and Nancy Pelosi had had their way. Let us be grateful to Joe for one more thing: out-maneuvering all of them for the good of the Democrats and democracy.

item.title: Rapha√´l L√©vy
item.description: Legal threat against me: a correction at PNAS, a follow-up at Retraction Watch, and pieces in Chemistry World, Science, and at the In The Pipeline¬†BlogPNAS did not publish the letter to the Editor I had submitted (and which led to a legal threat against me), but they did request that the authors publish a correction adding some of the references that I had cited in my letter. Eventually a correction was published on the 2nd of August, but as I told Retraction Watch‚Ä¶https://raphazlab.wordpress.com/2024/08/20/legal-threat-against-me-a-correction-at-pnas-a-follow-up-at-retraction-watch-and-pieces-in-chemistry-world-science-and-at-the-in-the-pipeline-blog/

item.title: Richard Sever
item.description: "as [bioRxiv and medRxiv ] become essential infrastructure, it makes sense to be supported by a diversity of stakeholders..several institutions offered financial support, including Stanford, MIT, Caltech, CNRS, Fred Hutch, Imperial, UW, & VU Amsterdam" üôè üôèüôè to all who have helped. The vision of bioRxiv/medRxiv has always been a non-profit, community effort and that includes funding. So if your institution would like to help too, please do get in touch! https://investinopen.org/blog/infrastructure-spotlight-biorxiv-and-medrxiv/

item.title: Tofu Golem
item.description: The American injustice system is so corrupt that no amount of reformation can possibly fix it. Remember this the next time some American president criticizes the justice system of another country.
